title: Ticket #1319: Bad -constraint to condor_status returns unhelpful error
description:
An invalid -constraint option to condor_status returns an unhelpful error message.

Current behavior: 

%  condor_status  -constraint 'foo X bar'
Error: communication error

Expected behavior: 

%  condor_status  -constraint 'foo X bar'
Error: Invalid constraint

Probably related: Ticket #1363: condor_status -collector broken: "Error: communication error"
remarks:
2010-Aug-23 17:42:37 by adesmet:
Bulk change of target version from v070403 to v070404 using ./ticket_target_mover.
2010-Oct-27 16:39:01 by adesmet:
Bulk change of target version from v070404 to v070405 using ./ticket-target-mover.

2012-Jun-27 15:01:11 by adesmet:
Mismatched parenthesis may be another useful case to test. Both of these current (7.8.1) return "communication error": 

condor_status -const '(foo'
condor_status -const 'foo)'

2012-Jul-19 21:19:02 by santos-g:
Implemented a working solution for this one, and submitted to NMI. I'm afraid that's not the best way to solve the problem, though.

2013-May-29 13:45:25 by tannenba:
Note the below commits are living on branch V7_9-multiple_constraint-branch. They will be code reviewed and merged along with other patches on this branch as part of #1156.

2013-Jun-28 13:55:19 by adesmet:
Ran into this problem again, with a user interpreting the error as a bug in HTCondor, when he had actually entered an invalid constraint. He specified JobId="14380548.0" when he meant JobId=="14380548.0", an easy mistake to make.

2013-Jul-08 16:27:13 by adesmet:
Code Review

This is only reviewing [35949] AKA f998f2cb, on the theory that the 2012-Jul-19 [32862] is a done deal.

As best I can tell, the change to /src/condor_daemon_client/daemon_list.cpp is stylistic, harmless, and unnecessary, but I'm not going to bounce it on that.

Perhaps a brief, "Improved error messages" in the version history?

No formal objections. Bouncing back to TJ to make the final determination in case he wants to make changes based on this review, but I'll sign off on marking the ticket as resolved.
